PREDICTPROTEIN.NAME: PredictProtein
PREDICTPROTEIN.QUOTE: B Rost and J Liu (2003) The PredictProtein Server. Nucleic Acids Research 31(13): 3300-3304.
PREDICTPROTEIN.DES: PredictProtein is the acronym for all prediction programs run.

PROSITE.NAME: PROSITE
PROSITE.DONEBY: A Bairoch, bairoch@cmu.unige.ch P Bucher & K Hofmann
PROSITE.QUOTE: A Bairoch, P Bucher & K Hofmann (1997) Nucleic Acids Research, 25:217-221
PROSITE.DES: PROSITE is a database of functional motifs. ScanProsite, finds all functional motifs in your sequence that are annotated in the ProSite db.

SEG.NAME: SEG
SEG.DONEBY: J C Wootton & S Federhen, wootton@ncbi.nlm.nih.gov
SEG.QUOTE: J C Wootton & S Federhen (1996) Methods in Enzymology, 266:554-571
SEG.DES: SEG divides sequences into regions of low-, and high-complexity. Low-complexity regions typically correspond to 'simple sequences' or 'compositionally-biased' regions.

PRODOM.NAME: ProDom
PRODOM.DONEBY: LL Sonnhammer; J Gouzy, F Corpet, F Servant, D Kahn, dkahn@zyx.toulouse.inra.fr
PRODOM.QUOTE: ELL Sonnhammer & D Kahn (1994) Protein Science, 3:482-492
PRODOM.DES: ProDom is a database of putative protein domains. The database is searched with BLAST for domains corresponding to your protein.

MAXHOM.NAME: MaxHom
MAXHOM.DES: MaxHom is a dynamic multiple sequence alignment program which finds similar sequences in a database.
MAXHOM.QUOTE: MaxHom: C Sander R Schneider (1991) Proteins, 9:56-68

MVIEW.NAME: MView
MVIEW.QUOTE: MView: N P Brown, C Leroy & C Sander (1998) Bioinformatics, 14:380-381
MVIEW.DES: MView is a program converting multiple sequence alignments into fancy HTML formatted output.
MVIEW.COPYRIGHT: Copyright (C) Nigel P. Brown, 1997-1998. All rights reserved.

PHD.NAME: PHD
PHD.DES: PHD is a suite of programs predicting 1D structure (secondary structure, solvent accessibility) from multiple sequence alignments.

PHDSEC.NAME: PHDsec
PHDSEC.QUOTE: B Rost & C Sander (1993) J. of Molecular Biology, 232:584-599
PHDSEC.DES: PHDsec predicts secondary structure from multiple sequence alignments.

PHDACC.NAME: PHDacc
PHDACC.DES: PHDacc predicts per residue solvent accessibility from multiple sequence alignments.

PHDHTM.NAME: PHDhtm
PHDHTM.QUOTE: B Rost, P Fariselli & R Casadio (1996) Protein Science, 7:1704-1718
PHDHTM.DES: PHDhtm predicts the location and topology of transmembrane helices from multiple sequence alignments.

PROF.NAME: PROF
PROF.QUOTE: B Rost (2004) Meth. Mol. Biol., submitted.
PROF.DES: PROF is a suite of programs predicting 1D structure (secondary structure, solvent accessibility) from multiple sequence alignments.

PROFSEC.NAME: PROFsec
PROFSEC.QUOTE: B Rost (2004) Meth. Mol. Biol., submitted.
PROFSEC.DES: PROFsec predicts secondary structure from multiple sequence alignments.

PROFACC.NAME: PROFACC
PROFACC.QUOTE: B Rost (2004) Meth. Mol. Biol., submitted.
PROFACC.DES: PROFacc predicts per residue solvent accessibility from multiple sequence alignments.

GLOBE.NAME: GLOBE
GLOBE.DES: GLOBE predicts the globularity of a protein

CYSPRED.NAME: CYSPRED
CYSPRED.DONEBY: Fariselli P, Riccobelli P, Casadio R
CYSPRED.QUOTE: Fariselli P, Riccobelli P & Casadio R (1999) PROTEINS 36:340-346
CYSPRED.DES: CYSPRED finds whether the cys residue in your protein forms disulfide bridge.

CONF.NAME: A conformational switch prediction program
CONF.DONEBY: Young M, Kirshenbaum K, Dill KA and Highsmith S.
CONF.DES: ASP finds regions that are most likely to behave as switches in proteins known to exhibit this behavior
